title: GenAI Advanced
description: Advanced techniques and strategies for working with Generative AI systems
intro: This page focuses on how GenAI models work internally: understanding embeddings and vectors, exploring advanced techniques like RAG and function calling, and building agentic systems that go beyond simple prompts.

sections.title: Vectors and embeddings: How AI understands meaning
content: Everything an AI processes—words, images, concepts—gets converted into **vectors**, which are simply lists of numbers. Think of a vector as a precise coordinate in multi-dimensional space that captures the essence of what something means.
**Embeddings** are sophisticated vectors that capture semantic meaning. When an AI learns that "dog" and "puppy" are related, it places their embeddings close together in this mathematical space.

sections.title: From embeddings to responses: The inference process
content: Inference is what happens when you send a prompt to an AI model and receive a response. The model converts your words into embeddings, processes those mathematical representations through its neural network, and converts the results back into human-readable text.
During inference, the model doesn't "think" the way humans do. Instead, it performs billions of mathematical calculations to predict the most likely next word.

subsections.title: The foundation of learning
subsections.content: A neural network mimics how biological brains process information through interconnected nodes. Each connection has a *weight*—a number that determines how much influence one piece of information has on another.

subsections.title: Transformers: A revolutionary architecture
subsections.content: Modern language models use transformers, a revolutionary architecture that changed how AI understands language. Unlike earlier approaches that processed text sequentially, transformers can examine entire passages simultaneously.

sections.title: Attention mechanism
content: The breakthrough innovation in transformers is the attention mechanism. When generating each word, the model can "attend to" or focus on the most relevant parts of the input.
For example, when translating "The cat that was sleeping on the mat was orange," the attention mechanism helps the model understand that "orange" describes "cat," not "mat."

sections.title: Context windows and model parameters
sections.intro: These core concepts determine what a model can do and how it behaves.

subsections.title: Parameters and model capability
subsections.content: The parameters in a model directly impact capability. GPT-3 has 175 billion parameters, while some newer models have over a trillion.

subsections.title: Context windows
subsections.content: Context windows determine how much information a model can consider at once. Larger context windows allow models to maintain coherence across longer conversations.

subsections.title: Training data and knowledge cutoff
subsections.content: The training data shapes what the model knows. The cut-off date represents the latest information in this training data.

techniques.name: Grounding
techniques.description: Provides the AI with specific, factual information to base its responses on.

techniques.name: Temperature
techniques.description: Controls how creative or predictable the AI's responses are.

techniques.name: Top P (nucleus sampling)
techniques.description: Determines how many alternative words the model considers when generating each token.

sections.title: Function calling
sections.intro: Function calling allows AI models to use external tools and services during their responses.
workflow: You define functions with clear descriptions of what they do and what parameters they need
The AI model analyzes your prompt and determines if any functions would help answer your question
The model calls the appropriate function with the right parameters
The function returns results, which the model incorporates into its response

sections.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP)
content: MCP is an open protocol that standardizes how applications provide context to LLMs. It enables secure, two-way connections between AI systems and data sources.
MCP allows AI assistants to access files, databases, APIs, and other resources in a standardized way.

sections.title: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
sections.intro: RAG combines the generative capabilities of LLMs with external knowledge retrieval.
workflow: System retrieves relevant documents from a knowledge base
Retrieved context is added to the prompt
LLM generates a response grounded in the retrieved information
benefits: Reduces hallucinations by grounding responses in factual data
Allows access to current information beyond training data

sections.title: Agents and agentic AI
sections.intro: AI agents are systems that can autonomously plan and execute multi-step tasks.
characteristics: Autonomous: Make decisions without constant human intervention
Tool-using: Leverage external tools and APIs
Adaptive: Adjust plans based on results and feedback
